summary: This is an email from attorney Teri Gibbs to the U.S. Attorney's Office, following up on a prior communication regarding two clients who allege they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in June 2004. The email seeks confirmation on whether the clients appear in photographs seized from Epstein's home and attempts to schedule interviews for the clients.

persons.name: Teri Gibbs
persons.context: Attorney who is communicating with the U.S. Attorney's Office on behalf of two clients who believe they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein. She is arranging interviews and inquiring about photographs.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the individual who allegedly assaulted the attorney's clients in or around June 2004. Photographs were seized from his home.

persons.name: Colleen Mullen
persons.context: Appears as a recipient (Cc) on the email, likely a prosecutor or staff member at the U.S. Attorney's Office.

connections.description: Gibbs is an attorney representing clients who are alleged victims of Epstein, making her an opposing legal party in the investigation.

events.title: Alleged assault by Epstein
events.description: Two clients of attorney Teri Gibbs believe they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in or around June 2004.

events.title: Initial attorney call with prosecutors
events.description: Teri Gibbs's firm spoke with the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding their clients who are alleged victims of Epstein.

events.title: Initial email to prosecutors
events.description: Teri Gibbs sent an initial email to the U.S. Attorney's Office providing client availability for interviews and attaching client photographs.

events.title: Follow-up email regarding photographs
events.description: Teri Gibbs follows up on the August 5 email, specifically to confirm whether her clients are depicted in photographs seized from Epstein's home.

keyFacts: Two new alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein are represented by attorney Teri Gibbs, with assaults alleged to have occurred in or around June 2004.
The attorney is actively cooperating with the U.S. Attorney's Office, providing client photographs and scheduling interviews for August 2019.
A key investigative request is to determine if the attorney's clients appear in photographs seized from Jeffrey Epstein's home.
The document demonstrates ongoing victim outreach and evidence review by prosecutors in the Epstein case (19 Cr. 490) as of late 2019.
